title: Let’s Get Together and Talk to Each Other!
description: You're invited to our first Agile Community Event on March 14!

title: Holidays Halting Agility? Bah Scrumbug!
description: Keeping with the spirit of the season, we wanted to offer some guidance on the most common questions we get asked during this time. Stay Merry and Bright with the Following Tips for Team Success!

title: Say What!? Decoding Agile Terminology
description: Have you heard an unfamiliar word or phrase in a team meeting and didn’t want to ask what it meant? If so, don’t worry – you’re definitely not alone. Below are a few words or phrases you may have overheard and simple explanations of what they actually mean.

title: Agile & Distributed Teams - It Can Work!
description: According to a VersionOne survey, 4 out of 5 people work on a distributed team. Yet when discussing good practices in Agile, collocation always comes up as something the team should strive for. How then, can a distributed team work effectively with one another when issues like different time zones, schedules, and a lack of face-to-face communication seem like insurmountable challenges?

title: The Wrong Way To Do Retrospectives
Characteristics of a High-Functioning and Well-Adapted Team
description: With 40+ years of combined experience, our Coaching team has seen a wide range of group dynamics across many lines of business… and the most effective teams demonstrate the following key characteristics.

title: 3 ways we shouldn’t use metrics
description: Metrics play an important role in the agile community. They help us measure progress, identify opportunities for improvement, and much more.  But we must be careful when wielding the mighty power of data – here are some of the most common metric misuses to avoid.

title: Do More... by Doing Less
description: While it may seem counterintuitive, most teams can accomplish more by focusing on less

title: Are you SAFe in Agile?
description: SAFe means something totally different to an agile coach - introducing the Scaled Agile Framework for Enterprise

title: Six Tips for Saying No To Stakeholders
description: Learning to say no to stakeholders is a skill every Product Owner should learn.

title: Does Less Feedback Mean We're Less Agile?
description: Teams operate more efficiently when they receive consistent and constructive feedback faster

title: Delivering Value Using Personas
description: A common challenge for teams is identifying and delivering the value proposition in stories. Learn how adopting personas can help.

title: Don't just DO agile - BE agile!
description: Our team is commonly asked How can we do agile? The real question, however, is, How can we be agile?

title: Simplifying User Stories
description: Whether your team has great, workable stories today, or every story is carrying over every sprint, these tips for simplifying stories are great and proven.

title: Introducing the Agile Connection
description: Welcome to the Agile Connection, a monthly newsletter to keep you up to date on agile best practices. Written by our team of Disney Agile Coaches, Marco, Mark and Mike.
